channel.title: Website of Kazuki Motohashi
channel.description: Recent content on Website of Kazuki Motohashi

item.description: 元橋 一輝 略歴 2024年9月〜 一橋大学大学院経済学研究科 講師（テニュアトラック） 2023年7月〜2024年8月 一橋大学社会科学高等研究院 特任講師 2023年 タフツ大学 博士号（PhD in Economics and Public Policy） 取得
Mount Fuji（富士山） From Kawaguchiko Station (Fujikawaguchiko, Yamanashi) From Kawaguchi Lake (Fujikawaguchiko, Yamanashi) From Fujimi-doori (Kunitachi, Tokyo) From Yagawa Station (Kunitachi, Tokyo)
Fieldwork in Bihar, India (November-December 2021) Fieldwork in Bihar, India (August 2023)
Notes on Research Article on JADE (Japanese Association for Development Economics) Letter No.
Welcome! I am an incoming Assistant Professor in the Graduate School of Economics at Hitotsubashi University (starting in Fall 2024).

Working Papers 1. Unintended Consequences of Sanitation Investment: Negative Externalities on Water Quality and Health in India [Osaka University ISER Moriguchi Prize, World Bank Blog Post, VoxDev Article] Submitted

Hitotsubashi University Introductory Microeconomics (undergraduate), Hitotsubashi University, Fall-Winter 2024 Gakushuin University Instructor, Economic Development (undergraduate), Fall 2020 [Syllabus]

World Heritage in Japan Shirakami-Sanchi (Aomori and Akita) Shrines and Temples of Nikko (Tochigi) Gusuku Sites and Related Properties of the Kingdom of Ryukyu (Okinawa) Fujisan, Sacred Place and Source of Artistic Inspiration (Shizuoka and Yamanashi) The Tomioka Silk Mill and Related Sites (Gunma) Sites of Japan's Meiji Industrial Revolution: Iron and Steel, Shipbuilding and Coal Mining (Iwate, Shizuoka, Yamaguchi, Fukuoka, Kumamoto, Saga, Nagasaki and Kagoshima) Hidden Christian Sites in the Nagasaki Region (Nagasaki, Kumamoto)
Hitotsubashi Institute for Advanced Study (HIAS), Hitotsubashi University 2-1, Naka, Kunitachi, Tokyo 186-8601 Japan
